lines.text: Ohhh... you stopped wanting. Ahhh, not needing.
Hey, it's all the difference in the world. Your belly needs. Your heart wants. That's the difference.
The house God is building for me. Is it finished yet?
You can't really call it a house Grandpa. It's more like a palace.
Ahhh, really? Wh-What's it made of?

Nah. Made of bricks. You see when you're born... God starts building a house for you in heaven. And every time you do a good deed, he puts a brick on your house. And when you do a bad deed, he takes a brick off. So, since I did more good in my life than bad, I think maybe my house almost finished.
Ohhh. I suffered enough without dyin', maybe I'm gonna die without suffering.
Then take this damn blanket off, I'm roasting to death.
Have I ever broken a promise?
What kind of world is it when someone you love can sit in the sun all day and not get some color in his cheeks?

[when a dime rolls out of his grandfather's hands after he has just died]
Thanks, grampa.
